intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. parva, commonly known as the small desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to store water, while its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
